subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 15 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Blackburn 1-2 Chelsea (aet)
Chelsea's Michael Ballack grabs the winner in an enthralling FA Cup semi-final win over a battling Blackburn.



 
Everton 2-1 Charlton
James McFadden breaks Charlton hearts with an injury-time winner to take Everton into fifth spot.



 
Wigan 3-3 Tottenham
Relegation-battlers Wigan are pegged back three times by a Tottenham side chasing a Uefa Cup berth.








GOLF




Brier seals victory in China Open
Austria's Markus Brier wins the China Open by five strokes in Shanghai.



 
Kelly aces to take Heritage lead
American Jerry Kelly fires a hole-in-one on his way to a third round 67 to take a one-shot lead at the Verizon Heritage.



 
Davies & Ochoa stay out in front
Laura Davies and Lorena Ochoa are four shots clear of the field going into the final day of the LPGA Ginn Open in Florida.








MOTORSPORT




Massa holds off battling Hamilton
Ferrari's Felipe Massa wins the Bahrain Grand Prix as Lewis Hamilton makes history by finishing second.



 
Hamilton sets sights on first win
Lewis Hamilton says he is not far from his first victory after becoming the first driver to finish on the podium in his first three races.



 
Bahrain GP as it happened
Ferrari's Felipe Massa beats McLaren's Lewis Hamilton in the Bahrain Grand Prix to win his first race of the season.








FORMULA ONE




Massa holds off battling Hamilton
Ferrari's Felipe Massa wins the Bahrain Grand Prix as Lewis Hamilton makes history by finishing second.



 
Hamilton sets sights on first win
Lewis Hamilton says he is not far from his first victory after becoming the first driver to finish on the podium in his first three races.



 
Bahrain GP as it happened
Ferrari's Felipe Massa beats McLaren's Lewis Hamilton in the Bahrain Grand Prix to win his first race of the season.








ATHLETICS




Holmes set to race in Manchester
Double Olympic gold medallist Dame Kelly Holmes will take part in the Great Manchester Run.



 
O'Sullivan winds down in Dublin 
Sonia O'Sullivan will make her final Irish road race appearance in Sunday's Great Bupa Ireland Run.



 
Liu signs up to run in British GP
China's Olympic 110m hurdles champion and world record holder Liu Xiang will compete in the British Grand Prix in Sheffield in July.








CYCLING




O'Grady takes Paris-Roubaix glory
Stuart O'Grady becomes the first-ever Australian winner of the Paris-Roubaix cycling classic.



 
Cooke's winning run finally ends
Dutch rider Adrie Visser wins the third round of the World Cup, Nicole Cooke edged out in the final sprint.



 
Hammond takes second in Belgium
Britain's Roger Hammond finished in second place in the Gent-Wevelgem one-day classic in Belgium.
